humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, both the sentinel lymph nodes (No. 1 and No. 2) and the additional assessed lymph nodes (3 sentinel axillary and 2 axillary) are negative for tumor or metastatic carcinoma. This information aligns with New Rule 11 and Rule 8, which state that N0 indicates no metastatic carcinoma in all assessed lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that multiple sentinel and axillary lymph nodes were excised and found to be negative for tumor. This means that there is no evidence of cancer in the lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N0 stage. The immunohistochemical studies also support this finding as they were negative for metastatic carcinoma.
